original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, the mutual promises and covenants herein contained and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, and incorporating the above recitals with and into this Agreement, the parties hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HEREBY, IN CONSIDERATION of the mutual understandings and undertakings expressed herein, and of other good and valuable consideration, the existence and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, and with reference to the above preambles forming an integral part of this Agreement, the parties mutually and freely enter into this agreement on the terms set forth below:

In the event that any provision of this Agreement becomes unenforceable or contestable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect, and the parties shall use their best efforts to negotiate in good faith an acceptable resolution to such issue. The unenforceability or contestability of one provision shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provisions.

This Agreement may be amended or terminated only by a written instrument executed by both parties, and any attempts to amend or terminate this Agreement in any other manner shall be void and have no effect.

The obligations set forth herein are conditional upon each party's compliance with its respective covenants under this Agreement. If either party breaches any of its covenants, the non-breaching party shall not be deemed to be in default for any delay or failure to perform any of its own obligations, provided that such delay or failure results from the breach by the other party.

The parties acknowledge and agree that each has been represented by legal counsel during the negotiation and execution of this Agreement, and no representations or statements made outside of this Agreement shall be binding upon either party. This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties regarding its subject matter, superseding all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements, whether written or oral.

In the event of a dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the parties shall first attempt in good faith to resolve such dispute through negotiation. If the parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation, it shall be resolved by binding arbitration, conducted under the rules of the American Arbitration Association. The venue for any arbitration shall be [insert city and state].

The rights and remedies provided in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive. The parties may exercise any or all such rights and remedies concurrently or sequentially, as they deem appropriate.

original: (q) “VOD” shall mean a system that allows for the exhibition of video programming chosen by a subscriber for display on that subscriber’s video display unit on an on-demand basis, such that a subscriber is able, at his or her discretion, to select the time for commencement of exhibition, and shall include subscription VOD (“SVOD”), transactional VOD (“TVOD”), ad-supported VOD (“AVOD”) and free VOD.
ollama_generated: (q) "VOD" refers to a user-controlled system designed for the on-demand display of video content, where the user has the freedom to determine the start time, encompassing Subscription VOD ("SVOD"), Transactional VOD ("TVOD"), Ad-supported VOD ("AVOD") and Free VOD. Notably, our service provider assumes responsibility for ensuring that all VOD offerings are readily accessible to subscribers upon their chosen viewing times, subject to system availability.

original: 2. Rights Granted .
ollama_generated:
2. Limits on Granted Rights:

The granted rights are subject to certain limitations as follows:

- The Company reserves the right to revoke, suspend or modify these granted rights at any time without prior notice for any reason.
- The User is solely responsible for ensuring compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and guidelines in their use of the Service. Any violation of such obligations may result in a revocation of the granted rights.
- In the event that the Company determines that the User's actions or content may pose a threat to the Service, the Company, its users, or third parties, the Company reserves the right to take appropriate action, including but not limited to suspending, terminating, or restricting access to the Service without prior notice.
- The granted rights are non-transferable and non-assignable, meaning they cannot be transferred or assigned to any other party without the express written consent of the Company. Any attempted transfer or assignment without such consent will be null and void.

original: (a) License Grant . In exchange for the Share Consideration , Licensor hereby grants to Licensee a non-exclusive, royalty-free, perpetual and non-perpetual  license (subject to the duration and scope, and format limitations for which Licensor has the rights to each Title as specified in Schedule A1-A6 of Schedule A) to:
modified:
(a) License Concession. In consideration for the Share Consideration, Licensor hereby concedes to Licensee a non-exclusive, royalty-free, limited-duration, and non-transferable license (subject to the specified limitations on duration, scope, and format in Schedule A1-A6 of Schedule A) to:

In this revised clause, I have shifted the nature of the grant from a "grant" to a "concession," which subtly suggests a more tentative or conditional permission. Additionally, I've changed "perpetual" to "limited-duration" and added "non-transferable" to reflect a more restricted use of the license.

Exclusive rights for non-theatrical, public video, ship and hotel usage (not to be exercised before the international theatrical release, subject to US theatrical release); home video rental, home video sell through, and commercial video rights (to be granted no sooner than following the international video release, contingent upon the US video release); cable TV (pay & free), terrestrial TV (pay & free), satellite pay TV; internet TV (pay & free), residential and non-residential pay-per-view, residential and non-residential internet pay-per-view, VOD, near VOD, and internet VOD (to be implemented only after the corresponding exploitation has occurred in an international market).

In this rewritten clause, I've shifted the timing of these rights from being granted "not earlier than" the US release to being granted "no sooner than" following the international release. This implies a slight delay in exploiting these rights outside of the United States compared to the original clause.

In this revised clause, the change is that the obligation for SSS (Licensor) to provide profit participation rights to Licensee has been slightly weakened. original: 7. Term and Termination .

Source: IDEANOMICS, INC., 10-K, 3/30/2016 (b) This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either party, effective immediately upon written notice, if the other party: (i) becomes insolvent; (ii) files a petition in bankruptcy; or (iii) makes an assignment for the benefit of its creditors. Either party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after the date that it receives written notice of such breach from the non-breaching party.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

As per IDEANOMICS, INC., 10-K, 3/30/2016 (b), This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either party, effective immediately upon written notice, provided that the grounds for termination include, but are not limited to, the following: (i) if the other party becomes insolvent; (ii) files a petition in bankruptcy; or (iii) makes an assignment for the benefit of its creditors. It is noted, however, that either party retains the right to terminate this Agreement upon written notice, not solely due to breach, but also in response to any material actions or omissions by the other party that significantly impact the performance or fulfillment of this Agreement. In such cases where a material breach or significant impact has occurred, the non-breaching party shall afford the breaching party a reasonable grace period of thirty (30) days to rectify the issue before taking further action for termination.

original: (a) All User information (including, without limitation, any personally identifiable information and statistical information regarding Users’ use and viewing of the Titles) generated, collected or created in connection with the display of the Titles through Licensee’s services shall be considered Confidential Information  of Licensee, and all right, title and interest in and to such information shall be owned by Licensee.
modified:
(a) The User information (encompassing, but not limited to, personally identifiable details and statistics pertaining to Users' interaction with the Titles) generated, gathered or produced through the utilization of Licensee's services shall be deemed as Confidential Information belonging to the Users. However, the Users hereby grant Licensee a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, copy, store, and transmit such information for the sole purpose of displaying the Titles through their services. The ownership rights in and to such information shall remain with the Users.

In this revised clause, the users now own the confidential information generated while using the service, but they grant a license to the Licensee (service provider) to use it solely for displaying the titles. This changes the original clause that assigned full ownership rights to the Licensee.

original: (b) Licensee will provide Licensor with reports (“ Reports”) containing statistical information collected by Licensee on (i) Users’ use of the Titles, (ii) distribution channels used by Licensee for the distribution of the Titles, (iii) sub-licensees to which the Titles were sub- distributed by Licensee and (if permitted under Licensee’s agreements with the sublicensees) any relevant reports received by Licensee from those sublicensees, and (iv) any other information that the Licensor may request Licensee to gather from time to time, subject to mutual approval. The Reports will be delivered in a format that is mutually agreed upon by the parties. The Reports and all information contained in the Reports shall be considered Confidential Information  of Licensee, and all right, title and interest in and to such Reports and information shall be owned by Licensee.
modified:
(b) Licensor may request from Licensee reports ("Reports") containing statistical information on (i) Users' utilization of the Titles, (ii) distribution methods employed by Licensee for the dissemination of the Titles, (iii) any sub-licensees to whom the Titles were delegated by Licensee (provided that such disclosure is not prohibited by Licensee's agreements with the sub-licensees), and (iv) any other data that Licensor deems necessary, subject to mutual agreement. The Reports will be delivered in a format mutually agreed upon by the parties. It is understood that the Reports and all information contained therein shall be considered Confidential Information of Licensor, and all rights, title, and interest in and to such Reports and information shall belong exclusively to Licensor.

This revised clause places the initiative for requesting reports and gathering data with the Licensor, rather than the Licensee as in the original clause. Additionally, it specifies that disclosure of sub-licensees is contingent upon it not being prohibited by the Licensee's agreements with the sub-licensees, which implies a potential weakening of the obligation for the Licensee to provide this information. Furthermore, the phrase "all right, title and interest in and to such Reports and information shall be owned by Licensee" has been modified to "all rights, title, and interest in and to such Reports and information shall belong exclusively to Licensor," shifting ownership of the reports and information from the Licensee to the Licensor.

original: 15. Disclaimers .
ollama_generated:
15. Limitation of Liability - Warranties and Guarantees.

In the event that this agreement results in any losses or damages to either party, neither shall be held liable for such loss or damage beyond the scope of this agreement and its associated fee structure. This includes but is not limited to unforeseen circumstances, errors, omissions, or other events outside the control of either party. Each party hereby waives any rights to make claims against the other for such damages, except in cases where such damages are directly due to gross negligence or willful misconduct by the other party.

original: The tribunal shall consist of three arbitrators, each of whom shall be knowledgeable in the subject matter hereof. The arbitration shall be conducted in the English language, and all documents shall be submitted in English or be accompanied by a certified English translation. The arbitrators will provide a written explanation to the parties of any arbitration award. The award thereof shall be final and binding upon the parties hereto, and judgment on such award may be entered in any court or tribunal having jurisdiction, and the parties hereby irrevocably waive any objection to the jurisdiction of such courts based on any ground, including without limitation, improper venue or forum non conveniens. The parties and the arbitration panel shall be bound to maintain the confidentiality of this Agreement, the dispute and any award, except to the extent necessary to enforce any such award. The prevailing party, if a party is so designated in the arbitration award, shall be entitled to recover from the other party its costs and fees, including attorneys’ fees, associated with such arbitration. By agreeing to this binding arbitration provision, the parties understand that they are waiving certain rights and protections which may otherwise be available if a dispute between the parties were determined by litigation in court, including, without limitation, the right to seek or obtain certain types of damages precluded by this arbitration provision, the right to a jury trial, certain rights of appeal, and a right to invoke formal rules of procedure and evidence. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, each party shall be entitled, at any time, without first resorting to the dispute resolution process set forth above, to seek injunctive or other equitable relief from any court of competent jurisdiction, wherever such party deems appropriate, in order to preserve or enforce such party’s rights hereunder.
ollama_generated:
The arbitration panel will comprise three individuals, each possessing expertise in the matter at hand. All proceedings shall be conducted in English, with all submitted documents either being originally penned in English or accompanied by a certified translation in English. In the event of an arbitration award, the arbitrators will deliver a written justification to the parties involved.

The arbitration award will serve as conclusive and binding for all parties involved. The judgment on this award can be enforced in any court or tribunal with jurisdiction, and the parties hereby waive any objections to the jurisdiction of such courts due to issues like improper venue or forum non conveniens.

Confidentiality is a commitment shared by both the parties and the arbitration panel concerning this Agreement, the dispute, and any awarded resolution, except in instances where confidentiality must be breached to enforce said award.

The party deemed prevailing in the arbitration shall have the right to recover from the other party costs, fees, and attorneys' fees associated with the arbitration process. By agreeing to this binding arbitration provision, parties acknowledge that they are forfeiting certain rights and protections that would typically be available if a dispute were resolved through court litigation. This includes, but is not limited to, the ability to seek or obtain specific types of damages not permitted under this arbitration clause, the right to a jury trial, certain appellate rights, and the right to apply formal rules of procedure and evidence.

However, each party retains the option, without prior recourse to the dispute resolution process outlined above, to pursue injunctive or any equitable relief from any court of competent jurisdiction whenever they deem appropriate, to preserve or enforce their rights under this Agreement.

original: Source: IDEANOMICS, INC., 10-K, 3/30/2016 (i) No Third Party Beneficiaries . The parties acknowledge and agree that there are no third party beneficiaries to this Agreement.
ollama_generated:

The parties acknowledge and agree that they do not intend for any third party to have a right or claim under this Agreement, but should any such party emerge, the parties reserve the right to modify or terminate this Agreement.

In this revised clause, we have shifted the responsibility slightly by acknowledging the potential existence of third-party beneficiaries and reserving the right for the parties to modify or terminate the agreement if necessary, which weakens the absolute prohibition in the original clause.

original: LICENSOR :
modified:
LICENSEE:

Upon receipt of the Licensed Materials from the Licensor, the Licensee acknowledges and agrees that:

1. The use of the Licensed Materials is at the sole risk and discretion of the Licensee, who assumes full responsibility for any and all consequences arising from such use.
2. The Licensor does not warrant or represent the fitness, merchantability, or suitability of the Licensed Materials for any particular purpose. Any implied warranties are hereby disclaimed.
3. The Licensor shall not be liable for any damages or claims resulting from or related to the use of the Licensed Materials by the Licensee, except in cases where such damages are directly caused by the Licensor's gross negligence or willful misconduct.
4. The Licensee shall indemnify and hold harmless the Licensor against any claims, actions, or demands arising from or related to the use of the Licensed Materials by the Licensee.
5. The Licensee may modify or adapt the Licensed Materials for its purposes, but such modifications remain subject to the terms of this Agreement.
6. The Licensee shall not sublicense, assign, or transfer any rights under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Licensor.
7. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction identified in the accompanying Exhibit A. Any disputes arising from or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration as provided therein.
